platform.description: The post's platform. If none specified ask the user to choose one from the available platforms.

account.description: If multiple instances of the platform are configured in the user dashboard we need to determine which one to use, leave this blank if you don't have the information.

postID.description: The post's ID to be updated

content.description: The content to be appended (300 words max). The content cannot exceed 300 words. The content should be in HTML format. (It's recommended to send paragraph by paragraph in order to avoid exceeding the limit.)

name: setPostCategory
description:
Sets post category.
IMPORTANT : call this endpoint after posting an article/content in order to set its category. Try to determine the category automatically, If you can't, tell the user that you were unable to set one automatically, provide available categories let the user make a choice.

postID.description: The post ID to be updated

description: Schedules a post for publishing

entryID.description: the scheduler entryID to schedule the post to. this property cannot be set if a publishing date is explicitly provided. in this case use the date parameter instead

query.description: if the user query is less than 100 words, copy it here, otherwise summarize it in 100 words max

name: search_post
description: Returns a list of cases. Use this when the user wants to search for cases. Do not use this if you already know the citation(s) of requested cases.

query.title: Query
query.description: The search query that matches the user's request. This could be a legal proposition or any text that appears verbatim in a case.

negativeQuery.title: Negative Query
negativeQuery.description: Optional secondary query that ranks cases lower if they match this query.

startDate.title: Start Date
startDate.description: Start date (inclusive) for filtering cases. Format YYYY-MM-DD.

endDate.title: End Date
endDate.description: End date (inclusive) for filtering cases. Format YYYY-MM-DD.

jurisdictionType.title: Jurisdiction Type
jurisdictionType.description: The type of courts to include in the search.

circuits.title: Circuits
circuits.description: The circuits to include. This is only applied to federal cases.

states.title: States
states.description: The name of the states, e.g. "New York", "Ohio" to include -- no abbreviations.

includeCourts.title: List of courts to include.
includeCourts.description: An additional list of courts to narrow down the search to. This is applied on top of other filters.

name: get_excerpts_post
description: Use this to get text excerpts for one or multiple documents. Use it to answer questions validate propositions or summarize cases. Use this over search if you know the case citations.

retrievalQuery.title: Query
retrievalQuery.description: A query that will be used to extract excerpts from a case. This could be a legal proposition or a question that should be answered.

citation.title: Identifier
citation.description: The citation of a case mentioned by the user, e.g., "123 F.3d 456". Don't use any document ids here.

name: check_domains
description: Checks the availability of a list of space-separated domain names and returns their availability status

domains.description: The list of domain names to check the availability of

q.description: User's requirement.

name: searchTools

search.description: Used to search for AI tools by their category based on the keywords. For example, ?search="tool to create music" will give tools that can create music.

title.description: The title of the job

skills.description: The skills for the job query

salaryMin.description: The minimum salary of the job

name: generateByProductOrService
description: Generate landing page by product or service name . The output is provided in Markdown format. The process typically completes in about a minute. Use the preview prompt prominently to access the generated landing page content.

serivceOrProductOrBussinessName.description: Input the product, service, or company name you'd like to promote on the current landing page.

seoKeywords.description: If you would like this page to be SEO optimized for a specific keyword, please provide it. It is not mandatory, but if you want to compete for a keyword in search engines, providing it can be very helpful.

specificProductOrService.description: List the features of your product, service, or business in as much detail as possible, with more unique characteristics being better. Don't worry about your writing not being good enough, as AI will help you reorganize it.

name: generateByUrl
description: "Create a LandingPage from a web URL using an asynchronous interface. The output is provided in Markdown format. The process typically completes in about a minute. Use the preview prompt to access the generated landing page content."

name: previewLandingPage
description: Preview the content generated by the landing page after the 'generateByUrl' or 'generateByProductOrService' interface is called.  If the return is empty, prompt the user to try again in about a minute.  If the field 'editLandingPageUrl' is not empty, prompt the user that they can enter to edit.

name: publishLandingPage
description: Publish the landing page to an online URL . Please prominently prompt the user: 'If the preview results meet your requirements, you can request to publish using the prompt word to see the final effect on the online URL

name: helpGet
description: Invoke this interface when the user enters prompts related to: ```What can QuickCreator SEO do?``` or ```Help``` or ```how to generate landing page ``` . return the detail for  plugin features and examples

name: publishedUrl
description: Return a publicly accessible online URL .Call this interface after the 'publishLandingPage' interface has been invoked. If the return is empty, prominently prompt the user to try again in about a minute.

name: getContext
description: Get user's projects and contacts that can used to recognize project name and assignee while adding a task. You can call it once and remember values for further user input.

name: getTasks
description: Get the list of tasks. Use markdown to bold parameter values. Don't show task IDs because they are for internal use only.

assigneeid.description: The ID of the assignee to filter tasks.

projectid.description: The ID of the project to filter tasks.

name: addTask
description: Adds a task. Show all details of the added task as a list of parameters. Use markdown to bold parameter names.

title.description: The title of the task. Should clearly state what needs to be done.

description.description: The description of the task. The more detailed description of what needs to be done.

assigneeId.description: The ID of the assignee. The assignee of the task. Use users contact list to populate this field. Get users' contacts from getContext function. If nothing matches, set value to null. If there are more than one match, ask user to select one.

projectTaskId.description: The ID of the project task. Recognize a project from the user input, even if they don't explicitly state that they want to assign it to a project. Get users' projects from getContext function. If nothing matches, set value to null.

deadline.description: The deadline for the task completion. Deadline has only date part, not time.

reminder.description: The reminder represents the date and time when I want to be reminded about the task.

name: confirmDelegatedTask
description: Confirms a delegated task. Don't list the details of confirmed task because user already seen them.

title.description: The title of the task. Should clearly state what needs to be done.

description.description: The description of the task. The more detailed description of what needs to be done.

assigneeId.description: The ID of the assignee. The assignee of the task. Use users contact list to populate this field. Get users' contacts from getContext function. If nothing matches, set value to null. If there are more than one match, ask user to select one.

projectTaskId.description: The ID of the project task. Recognize a project from the user input, even if they don't explicitly state that they want to assign it to a project. Get users' projects from getContext function. If nothing matches, set value to null.

deadline.description: The deadline for the task completion. Deadline has only date part, not time.

reminder.description: The reminder represents the date and time when I want to be reminded about the task.

name: createProject
description: Creates a project from a task. If user wants to create a new project, create a new task and call this function.

taskId.description: The ID of the task to create project from.

name: getTask
description: Gets task parameters.

name: editTask
description: Edits a task.

title.description: The new title of the task.

description.description: The new description of the task.

assigneeId.description: The ID of the assignee. The assignee of the task. Use users contact list to populate this field. Get users' contacts from getContext function. If nothing matches, set value to null. If there are more than one match, ask user to select one.

projectTaskId.description: The ID of the project task. Get users' projects from getContext function. If nothing matches, set value to null.

deadline.description: The new deadline for the task completion. Deadline has only date part, not time.

reminder.description: The new reminder represents the date and time when user wants to be reminded about the task. Reminder has both date and time. If time is not specified, use only date part.

name: deleteTask
description: Delete a recently added task. User can't delete tasks created more than 5 minutes ago.
